New Records: Jos Buttler needs 8 fours to reach 400 fours in ODIs.
Joe Root needs one more four to reach 500 fours in ODIs.
Devon Conway needs 126 more runs to reach 1000 runs in ODIs.
Trent Boult is three scalps away from 200 wickets in ODIs.
Sam Curran needs one more six to reach 50 sixes in ODIs.
Ben Stokes is two sixes away from 100 sixes in ODIs.
Key Match Events: Head-to-head stats show both teams have 44 wins each in 95 ODIs.
Ben Stokes is a doubt due to a niggle, while Kane Williamson is absent for New Zealand.
Pre-Game Insights: Tom Latham will captain New Zealand in the absence of Kane Williamson.
Ben Stokes' fitness is a key concern for England.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is the opening fixture of the World Cup at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.
The final of the World Cup will be held on November 19 in Ahmedabad.
Others: England and New Zealand both have rich histories in the World Cup, with New Zealand seeking their first win since 2019.
The match is crucial for both teams as it sets the tone for the tournament.
